intro: Heterotaenia arvensis, commonly known as the field horned poppy, is a flowering plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers with a horn-like structure at the base of the petals. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a lobed or toothed margin. Heterotaenia arvensis is an annual herb that blooms from late spring to early summer.
